sentences.en: A breakfast will be served to those who last out till dawn!
sentences.cn: 坚持到天亮的能吃上早餐！

sentences.en: a false dawn for the economy
At dawn I woke him up and said we were leaving.
sentences.cn: 黎明时分，我把他叫醒，告诉他我们要走了。

sentences.en: Harry held an umbrella over Dawn.
I hear Dawn's expecting again.
I started work at dawn and returned only at nightfall.
I was up at the crack of dawn (= very early in the morning ) to get the plane.
sentences.cn: 我一大早就起来赶飞机。

sentences.en: in the grey half-light of dawn
Nancy woke at dawn.
Paul talked unceasingly from dawn to dusk.
sentences.cn: 保罗滔滔不绝地从早说到晚。

sentences.en: People have been falling in love since the dawn of time.
The army imposed a dusk-to-dawn curfew.
sentences.cn: 军队强制实行黄昏至黎明的宵禁。

sentences.en: The business, founded by Dawn and Nigel, suffered financial setbacks.
sentences.cn: 唐和奈杰尔创办的企业在资金上遇到了一些问题。

sentences.en: the cold light of dawn
The morning dawned fresh and clear after the storm.
sentences.cn: 暴风雨过后，破晓时天朗气清。

sentences.en: The revels often last until dawn.
They continued the search as dawn broke.
sentences.cn: 天放亮后他们继续搜寻。

sentences.en: They set forth at dawn.
They start work at dawn .
sentences.cn: 天一亮他们就开始干活了。

sentences.en: We worked from dawn to dusk (= through the whole day while it is light ) .
When dawn broke (= the first light of the day appeared ) , we were still 50 miles from Calcutta.
sentences.cn: 破晓的时候，我们离加尔各答还有50英里。

trans.tran_en: the time when something began or first appeared
the time at the beginning of the day when light first appears

trans.tran_cn: 出现，开始，开始清楚，变得开朗
trans.tran_en: if day or morning dawns, it begins
